title: I got wrongfully banned for 14 days.
body:
Hello everyone.

So recently i got banned for 14 Days, For "Intentionally Feeding" When i actually wasn't, i was just having a really bad game.
Ban message : https://gyazo.com/a1029454e716fb1180e31234365b5c8e

(Pay attention to how it says "Some" and "These" Then only refers to one game.)

Here's the game i got banned for : http://matchhistory.eune.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/EUN1/1612934317/48397712?tab=overview

I'm the Yasuo, as you see, i was against Lee Sin in lane, and the guy was very good at Lee Sin, I'm not saying that i'm good, i suck, i really do, i'm really bad at this game, But that isn't a justification for my ban.
First thing first, i had wrong runes, And that's because i couldn't pick runes, I was disconnected from chat and the news thingy server (i'm using alpha client) which somehow affected my runes, it showed up as an empty box, furthermore, to prove that i didn't pick them wrong intentionally, i had right masteries, why would i pick right masteries and wrong runes...

I had Flash and Teleport, and i was playing Top, nothing wrong about that.
I started the game by saying "Fuck, wrong runes" Which they could easily find if they'd bother to check.
I had the highest CS in my team, and the 3rd highest in game.

As seen here : https://gyazo.com/a60ebb230edc02e7614f2297f213ca58

i had a completely normal build, Boots, Phantom Dancer, and ingredients for Trinity Force (Might be wrong, but i like to build it, check my other games as Yasuo)
I placed 4 wards, i didn't buy any but i did use my trinket which proves that i was trying to play.
I also had 6.6k damage done, which is more than the support (proves i'm trying) and 800 damage less than Vayne.

As seen here : https://gyazo.com/971f9e5034ac96684007cacc9f927c85

I've submitted tickets to Riot, But they don't investigate, They just reply with the same thing over and over again

First reply : https://gyazo.com/8ec04b1a7e321e135cb468fef91cf446

After i explained myself, This is what i got AGAIN : https://gyazo.com/ab909d7dfe630644ecb73c3cab32592f

(In the last image, this guy calls me "Kayne" when my name is clearly "Funoros")

He says that he investigated the case, ignoring everything i've said, and says that the ban is legit when it clearly isn't, then keeps bragging to me about how good there system is, 

as seen here : https://gyazo.com/cca647c143561bbb3c0825f1eb0f3ad7

And here : https://gyazo.com/03bf4c63aa5481f8b8a67c4a9cc55106

and here : https://gyazo.com/15f109f9908c751dac57e610e60af2d6

He just kept ignoring whatever i said and kept giving me advice on how to play, like i'm not even talking.

And when i asked for the replay file so i can prove that this ban is unjust and i don't deserve it by any means, He told me he can't provide me with it, 

As seen here : https://gyazo.com/7e36b04dc92475626b1a61c5802f38a6



I'll have to admit, i was acting stupid at some point, playing aggressive when i shouldn't and engaging on lee sin when he is ahead of me looking to outplay him and failing, But that doesn't mean i was intentionally feeding.

Riot has some good employees, they have a few hard working great members and like 50 lazy dickheads that are under qualified for the job, earlier today i was dealing with someone called "Bimmer Cake" Which is just a wonderful guy, he's the best support i've ever talked with, he's very kind and understanding, and i wish he handled my ticket instead of this copy pasting human.

Let me end this by saying that even if i did intentionally feed (which i swear to god i didn't), 1 game is no where near enough to ban me for, and it's basically absurd to ban me for one game of negative KDA, since i sometimes have good games and sometimes have bad games

 as seen here : https://gyazo.com/f213e5e2545d2a20383d09a16fb1a0b1


i just basically don't know what to do honestly, i really need help, i really care about the goodwill of my account, not only will 14 days risk my account for permanent suspension, but i will also not be able to play the game :(.

Thanks anyways.

replies.body:
Hey there Funoros. I'm really sorry this couldn't be resolved through support tickets. I've reviewed the game, and I agree with you that it's an error. There appears to be a lot of debate in the thread, but I pulled and watched the actual replay. I'm confident that this was a mistake of our systems and you were having an impressively bad game. I've unbanned your account.

I'm also going to see how we can use this case to improve our feeding detection systems. We know that mistakes in our system will happen, but we usually can accept them because 1) we work hard to keep them below a certain rate and 2) player support tickets should resolve them. In the case of verbal toxicity this is easy, but with feeding it's also not as easy for a human to make the call.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Chastise,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=0024,timestamp=2017-01-19T10:37:14.386+0000)
>
> Hey there Funoros. I'm really sorry this couldn't be resolved through support tickets. I've reviewed the game, and I agree with you that it's an error. There appears to be a lot of debate in the thread, but I pulled and watched the actual replay. I'm confident that this was a mistake of our systems and you were having an impressively bad game. I've unbanned your account.
> 
> I'm also going to see how we can use this case to improve our feeding detection systems. We know that mistakes in our system will happen, but we usually can accept them because 1) we work hard to keep them below a certain rate and 2) player support tickets should resolve them. In the case of verbal toxicity this is easy, but with feeding it's also not as easy for a human to make the call.

The biggest way you can improve your support ticket system is to stop using automated spambot responses. It's really frustrating to have an actual concern 2 and 3 emails into the conversation and still get copy and paste messages. It's extremely unprofessional and makes me feel, as a customer, that you literally do not care.

I can't imagine the number of cases you get daily, but maybe it's time to expand the customer service staff if copy pasta is your current best answer.

And the "just a bad game" excuse reigns supreme yet again . 

Now, I agree with you lifting the ban as this was done in a Normal game, but would you have also lifted it if it were in Ranked? At what point will you hold players accountable for feeding?

It seems you need to buy tears and just run down midlane, only then it will be intentional feeding. Cases like this are obviously "just a bad game". Oh, you died almost every single minute of the match fighting 4lvls ahead enemy? Poor you, let me give you a cookie.

> [{quoted}](name=duckarp,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=002400010000,timestamp=2017-01-19T11:40:30.847+0000)
>
> It seems you need to buy tears and just run down midlane, only then it will be intentional feeding. Cases like this are obviously "just a bad game". Oh, you died almost every single minute of the match fighting 4lvls ahead enemy? Poor you, let me give you a cookie.

When will admit that what you said about me was wrong, stop being so stubborn ;).

I won't admit something that is just wrong. There's no way a gold player would die 14 times in 22 minutes, obviously without trying and stubbornly just trying to fight a fed enemy. I don't know if you realize it, but this sets up a very dangerous precedense and don't be surprised when you suddenly find more and more people who will just intentionally ruin the game and then linking back to this thread.
Why would you care though, when you're already doing it, right...

It would only set a precedence if he was, in fact, intentionally feeding. You're only relying on circular reasoning of the type "I'm not wrong, because I'm right."

Look, I found the OP's story to be suspicious as well, but even then I said that the real reason I trust in Riot's decision was the fact that they have **all** the information available, and we have only very little information. And that still holds now that they have reverted their decision.

And honestly, the fact that you are implying that you can reach a more accurate conclusion despite having less information comes across as extremely arrogant.

Ok, so dying 14 times in 20minutes is ok, right? 
Also, what "less information" are you talking about? Do you play this game at all? How hard is it to guess the outcome of going ham when you're 4 levels behind and without items, against a fed enemy, after dying 13 times in a row? If you decide to go in anyway, how is it not intentional? What more information do you need in such case?

One last time - we are not talking about some newbie bronze player. We are talking about a player who played for at least 3 seasons and managed to get to gold, so he obviously knows the basics.

I'm not saying "I'm not wrong because I'm right", I'm stating facts here based on a simple game knowledge. I've been playing since 2011, so I hope I know what I am talking about. I don't see any proof from anyone who would prove me wrong. How is it possible to die almost every minute and do it "by accident" or due to "bad day"??? Seriously, please, give me the answer to that question. Unless OP has serious mental issues (which I doubt as he can construct sentences and obviously managed to register to play), it's just not possible. There's nothing that would hint he was actually trying to prevent dying. On the contrary, there's plenty of proof he was just dying over, and over, and over. Even provided a video how he tried to fight lee who was already 3-4 levels ahead!

>There's nothing that would hint he was actually trying to prevent dying.

Except flashes out of danger zones, dodges into own tower and the likes.
And what's it about asking for "proof" that someone can play this badly by accident? How would that work? Because when I would show you an example, you'd just assume it's intentional again. To everything I could possibly present you, you can just go "nu-uh, that's not true!".

And that's exactly the way you are arguing right now. Your entire point hinges upon it being impossible to play this badly without it being intentional, and you are just repeating that point over and over again. But repeating the same thing over and over again doesn't make it a fact.

Or the short version: Just because you don't believe something doesn't make it less plausible.

Also regarding this:
>Also, what "less information" are you talking about?

Chat. Previous game performances. Statistical analysis of previous game performances based on various different variables. The full replay. Pretty much most of the things that are important to beyond reasonable doubt prove that the feeding was intentional.
I mean, you are saying that there's nothing that would hint that he was actually trying to prevent dying, but the only parts of the replay you have are the parts where he does die. You have absolutely no information about how often he sucessfully avoided dying.

You can't dodge into own tower if you're pushing the lane and dying almost under the enemy tower, when your 1-2 towers are already gone.

It's not he was playing badly. It's the fact he couldn't stay alive for whole 2 minutes, as a gold player who played the game for 3 years, at least. How, please tell me, is that possible. By accident?

Can you tell me, how do you behave when you get 0/5 for instance? Can you try to describe here? Do you charge in, push even without towers, attack an enemy who has already 4 levels on you? Or do you try to play safe, hug the tower, try to coordinate with your jungler, group up with your team and try to minimize the feeding?

I'm not using circular reasoning, I'm trying to understand why would anyone defend him in such behavior. People like that ruin the experience for everyone. Defending people with 0/14 in 20minutes helps only the trolls, who know have a clear "proof" it's ok to do it and even see how to not get punished for it. Just do everything Funoros did and if you get caught by any chance, just link back here.

>  Just because you don't believe something

It's not about belief. If you think otherwise, please, start a game against bots and try to die as often as him. Then tell me it's perfectly possible and it didn't happen intentionally.

>How, please tell me, is that possible. 

How, please tell me, is it possible that people are bad at math. Like seriously, how is it possible that people cannot solve a system of linear equations in their head?

See how this is a bullshit question? That question is just a more convoluted version of the same point you keep on repeating (It's not possible to die so often by accident) to make it seem like you are not actually just repeating the same fucking thing over and over again.

>I'm not using circular reasoning [...]
>It's not about belief.

Then why don't you go ahead and explain **to me** how it's **im**possible to die so often by accident.
Or alternatively, provide me **any** argument that does not hinge on that assumption. The assumption that it's impossible to die so often by accident is the only thing you have. You wanna know what an assumption is? It's a belief. And when you are trying to support your assumption by repeating the same assumption over and over and over again, then that is circular logic.

Even the things that sound like new arguments ultimately rely purely on that assumption, like when you say

> Defending people with 0/14 in 20minutes helps only the trolls

because if your assumption is false, it obviously does **not** only help the trolls but also helps the innocents that would otherwise be punished..

>please, start a game against bots and try to die as often as him.

If I try to it would be intentional. Unless you are asking me to try to die unintentionally, which is logically not possible.

> [{quoted}](name=TrulyBland,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=0024000100000000000000010000000200000001,timestamp=2017-01-19T15:01:36.687+0000)
>
> How, please tell me, is it possible that people are bad at math. Like seriously, how is it possible that people cannot solve a system of linear equations in their head?
> 
> See how this is a bullshit question? You're just reversing the point you keep on repeating (It's not possible to die so often by accident) to make it seem like you are not, in fact, just repeating the same fucking thing over and over again.
> 
> Then why don't you go ahead and explain **to me** how it's **im**possible to die so often by accident.
> Or alternatively, provide me **any** argument that does not hinge on that assumption. The assumption that it's impossible to die so often by accident is the only thing you have. You wanna know what an assumption is? It's a belief. And when you are trying to support your assumption by repeating the same assumption over and over and over again, then that is circular logic.
> 
> Even the things that sound like new arguments ultimately rely purely on that assumption, like when you say
> 
> because if your assumption is false, it obviously does **not** only help the trolls but also helps the innocents that would otherwise be punished..
> 
> If I try to it would be intentional. Unless you are asking me to try to die unintentionally, which is logically not possible.

Come on dude, he's obviously asking to unintentionally die intentionally on purpose.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Chastise,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=0024,timestamp=2017-01-19T10:37:14.386+0000)
>
> Hey there Funoros. I'm really sorry this couldn't be resolved through support tickets. I've reviewed the game, and I agree with you that it's an error. There appears to be a lot of debate in the thread, but I pulled and watched the actual replay. I'm confident that this was a mistake of our systems and you were having an impressively bad game. I've unbanned your account.
> 
> I'm also going to see how we can use this case to improve our feeding detection systems. We know that mistakes in our system will happen, but we usually can accept them because 1) we work hard to keep them below a certain rate and 2) player support tickets should resolve them. In the case of verbal toxicity this is easy, but with feeding it's also not as easy for a human to make the call.

Hey, Thanks alot for the unban dude, you really made my whole week.

I'm sure we all appreciate your hard working to improve your system, and it's very okay for an automated system to make a mistake, and i'm really happy that you cared to investigate into this situation and unban my account, and it's okay for intentionally feeding people to get mixed up with people who have extremely bad games.

Again, thanks a lot for solving my problem, you rock dude,  i wish you the best, keep on improving, and goodluck.

Proof that you can lose on purpose, and if you're not "toxic" in chat, you won't get punished for it.

But hey, keep on wondering why the community is so toxic. Eventually you might realize there's a thing called cause and effect.

> So basically, Fuck you StonkyPac, you're literally the worst human (robot in fact, since all you do is copy paste) i've ever dealt with.
Riot has some good employees, they have a few hard working great members and like 50 lazy dickheads that are under qualified for the job.

Having worked for a major Internet company, and handling inbound email support, I can tell you for a fact that most of the responses handled by real human beings are "canned", or copy/paste responses. This is because their response to you is regarded as a direct response from the company as a whole and they have to be careful of the specific way they respond. 

So there is a pretty good chance that StonkyPac is a real person (operating under an alias/summoner name) who sent you the most relevant response to your inquiry. 

***

As for the specifics of your restriction, as already noted, Riot is able to see much more information than you are able to provide for us regarding your previous behavior. 

Riot will very rarely restrict a person's account based on a report from a single game unless the conditions are extremely severe, so it stands to reason that you have a history of behavior that lead up to this restriction.

> [{quoted}](name=Elite4Runner,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-01-17T11:14:02.128+0000)
>
> Riot has some good employees, they have a few hard working great members and like 50 lazy dickheads that are under qualified for the job.
> 
> Having worked for a major Internet company, and handling inbound email support, I can tell you for a fact that most of the responses handled by real human beings are "canned", or copy/paste responses. This is because their response to you is regarded as a direct response from the company as a whole and they have to be careful of the specific way they respond. 
> 
> So there is a pretty good chance that StonkyPac is a real person (operating under an alias/summoner name) who sent you the most relevant response to your inquiry. 
> 
> ***
> 
> As for the specifics of your restriction, as already noted, Riot is able to see much more information than you are able to provide for us regarding your previous behavior. 
> 
> Riot will very rarely restrict a person's account based on a report from a single game unless the conditions are extremely severe, so it stands to reason that you have a history of behavior that lead up to this restriction.

Here's a video of all my Deaths : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aoC0wTJsy4E

Check my OP.GG : Funoros EUNE, just a completely normal bad player with a good reason for being silver, no inting, nothing.

> [{quoted}](name=Funoros,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-01-18T04:21:09.239+0000)
>
> Here's a video of all my Deaths : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aoC0wTJsy4E
> 
> Check my OP.GG : Funoros EUNE, just a completely normal bad player with a good reason for being silver, no inting, nothing.

Do I think you were intentionally feeding? No. But I would say that you were consistently making a really bad decision to challenge a player who is 3 and 4 levels ahead of you in a 1v1. That is pretty much suicide, so the argument could be made. 

In this situation, there are three things that you can do. 

* Have your teammates help you kill the opponent by ganging up on them.
* Group with your teammates and apply pressure elsewhere. 
* Stall the game so their level and gold lead is less substantial. 
 
What I find most interesting is that the latter portion of your video is completely devoid of your teammates. Sure, your jungler was not helping in the beginning, but nobody else seems interested in helping you deal with this Lee Sin. That tells me that most likely they elected to not go with my first option, and were probably looking for the second option. 

You also didn't include the mini map in your video so I can't even tell what the situation of the macro game looked like. I would imagine that there was probably something you should have been doing with your team in order to salvage the game. 

Even if your plan was to stall, you can't really do so by dueling. Again, he is much stronger than you, and while you did a decent job of out playing him *at times*, he was ultimately too strong for you to fight. Aside from that, trying to stall as Yasuo against Lee Sin is already a poor decision. 

*** 

I personally would not have reported you for this, but once again, I am sure that there is more to the story for this game, as well as probably some other games that we are not able to see here.

I agree with your post 100%. There's a point at which careless feeding and intentional feeding become indistinguishable. He's got approximately one death for every 75 seconds of up-time, which is insane. Since it wasn't a ranked game, I don't think I would have reported him either. The fact is, though, going 0/14/1 has the same effect on other players' play experience whether the deaths are deliberate or not. I make a detailed argument for why doing this kind of thing in ranked games should be punishable in this post:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/6qUT19A0-intentional-vs-careless-feeding
I'd be interested in hearing your opinion on it, though preferably on that page.

As a Silver level player myself, I don't see anything in those deaths that I would think wasn't handled as good as could be expected. Yeah you fed, and yeah that sucked, but you could see that each time you were trying to play the fight the best you could. Like you said, one or two of those plays may have been you taking on more than you could handle, but nothing outrageous.

The last video I saw for someone "not intentionally feeding" involved them running towards the enemy turret when they were at 20% HP or less. For that person, yeah, they were intentionally feeding, but not you.

Maybe I'm just crazy, but it feels like it's a lot easier to give kill after kill after kill over to the other laner than it was last season. I've had several games this season where I've gone something like 0/8 when last season I'd be more likely to go 8/0. I don't know if I'm just playing too aggressively now or if something had just changed so much and I haven't picked up on it yet.

> [{quoted}](name=DrCyanide,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2017-01-18T04:45:51.510+0000)
>
> As a Silver level player myself, I don't see anything in those deaths that I would think wasn't handled as good as could be expected. Yeah you fed, and yeah that sucked, but you could see that each time you were trying to play the fight the best you could. 
> 
> The last video I saw for someone "not intentionally feeding" involved them running towards the enemy turret when they were at 20% HP or less. For that person, yeah, they were intentionally feeding, but not you.

Yay, finally someone who understands my point, forever silver bro xP.

lol, hopefully not "forever" silver. I lucked out in Flex Queue and was placed Gold 3 playing on my own, and so far I've been winning more than I've lost there. Just want to hit Gold 5 in Solo Queue then I'll get *all* the end of season rewards and be able to return to Normal games.

not agreeing with you but ill upvote this post so a rioter might look at it.

also; want a company to take you serious.

dont do this.

> So basically, Fuck you StonkyPac, you're literally the worst human (robot in fact, since all you do is copy paste) i've ever dealt with.

public shaming isn't even allowed on this boards and it makes you come of like an asshole.

Riot has more information than you can provide to us or that we can check on our own. It sounds like Riot employees responded to your messages time and time again, they just didn't accept your rational.

>So basically, Fuck you StonkyPac, you're literally the worst human (robot in fact, since all you do is copy paste) i've ever dealt with.
>Riot has some good employees, they have a few hard working great members and like 50 lazy dickheads that are under qualified for the job

Not exactly a great way to convince them.

On which account did you play that game? I don't see it on the account you are writing from right now

 I want to look some things up because from the game itself it doesn't look like int feeding but it looks like you were ignoring everything expect top and didn't want to group since all your deaths expect one happend on toplane.

"didn't want to group"

if i had a ad top laner that went 0/5, I'd ask him to just stay top and push. if the enemy team send any resources (aka that fed lee) to top to prevent yasuo from just freely mowing down towers, than that means most of the enemys team gold is top lane (the lee) and our remaining 4 have a good chance of taking on there remaining 4.
plus, any resources the enemy send to deal with yasuo get very little out of it since yasuo's bounty is low.


there isnt just one way to play the game. if you are having an absolute trash kda, you can use that to your advantage.

> [{quoted}](name=CooL Ice Tea,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-01-17T11:04:24.696+0000)
>
> On which account did you play that game? I don't see it on the account you are writing from right now
> 
>  I want to look some things up because from the game itself it doesn't look like int feeding but it looks like you were ignoring everything expect top and didn't want to group since all your deaths expect one happend on toplane.

Here's a video with all of my deaths : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aoC0wTJsy4E

HOLY SHIT!!!! 
I watched entire video and 0 reason for a ban, giant fail by automated banning system, and a giant fail on the part of automated responses from riot.

Not trying to sound mean, but from what i see here, you're an inter. you could've changed builds right at the end but that shouldn't really matter to anyone. You have no reason to post it here for riot to sift through player behavior when you can't seem to play your champion. you lost lane to a malphite who wasn't even a threat to you until 6. push him in and win lane or let him push and just pick at minions. you could've played safe but didn't and lee got a 12 AND 14 minute turret on your lane. What's that say? you need to learn your champion before playing him again so that way you're more comfortable. Enjoy your vacation and make a fresh account j/s

> What's that say? you need to learn your champion before playing him again so that way you're more comfortable

this is the answer for an unskilled player not for an - like you mentioned - intentional feeder
How can you learn your champion more without playing them? Seems like facetious advice.

You don't practice a champion by diving into lee who's extremely fed and 3-4 levels ahead of you. He was doing it repeatedly and it's not like he's a bronze/silver player. He was gold in S6. Going 0/14 like he did is just unacceptable. Sure, bad games happen, but if you have 0/5, you don't just push the lane and try to fight the enemy who's not just clearly better than you, but also very fed and far, far ahead.

> [{quoted}](name=duckarp,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=0006000000000002,timestamp=2017-01-18T10:51:07.154+0000)
>
> You don't practice a champion by diving into lee who's extremely fed and 3-4 levels ahead of you. He was doing it repeatedly and it's not like he's a bronze/silver player. He was gold in S6. Going 0/14 like he did is just unacceptable. Sure, bad games happen, but if you have 0/5, you don't just push the lane and try to fight the enemy who's not just clearly better than you, but also very fed and far, far ahead.

Ok so you're saying , that after watching the video, you're still not convinced that i wasn't actually inting and i was accideantly giving him kills because i didn't know what to expect?


Then you're a huge troll and i'm done talking to you.

I'm not a troll. I saw a video where you tried to kill a fed lee, over and over and over. Ignoring everything, just pushing and dying. It takes skill to die 14 times in a 20min game.
You can be mad at me, but I'm not surprised you got punished for that game. Don't try to tell me you didn't guess the outcome of diving a lee with much more items than you and 4 levels ahead. You were a gold player in S6, so you can drop the act.

1. yes, you were just going ham on him, over and over
2. yes, it took 22minutes. Using simple math it means you couldn't stay alive for 2 minutes straight
3. I think your sentence is a nice example
4. obviously yes if you died almost every minute of the match
5. gold, if you like it or not, means you belong to the upper 25-30% of the community skill-wise. So yes, after 3 years of playing and getting to gold, you should have a basic understanding of what happens if you're 0/5 yasuo and you try to fight an obviously better and extremely fed lee sin. You should have an understanding how to deal with the problem and mitigate the issue as much as you can = stop dying, group with the team and avoid fighting him at all costs.

> [{quoted}](name=duckarp,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3ebJ6oJ4,comment-id=00060000000000020000000000000000,timestamp=2017-01-18T11:06:31.690+0000)
>
> 1. yes, you were just going ham on him, over and over
> 2. yes, it took 22minutes. Using simple math it means you couldn't stay alive for 2 minutes straight
> 3. I think your sentence is a nice example
> 4. obviously yes if you died almost every minute of the match
> 5. gold, if you like it or not, means you belong to the upper 25-30% of the community skill-wise. So yes, after 3 years of playing and getting to gold, you should have a basic understanding of what happens if you're 0/5 yasuo and you try to fight an obviously better and extremely fed lee sin. You should have an understanding how to deal with the problem and mitigate the issue as much as you can = stop dying, group with the team and avoid fighting him at all costs.

did you even watch the video?

Ok cool.

You can practice in blinds/draft/bots. not in ranked. Never try a new champion in ranked it kills 4 other player's mentality to see you getting slain constantly for not knowing their kit completely like you should.

If you practice against bots you may get good at defeating bots. You need to practice like you play, in ranked players play differently than any other game mode. In order to start to win against players in ranked you need the understanding of what players are doing in ranked play. I find no correlation between learning things in "blinds/draft/bots" and what you will encounter in ranked play. I believe to get better he needs to play in ranked.

Remove the shaming, for better results.

I don't believe you.

I think you were playing legit at the beginning, then got tilted when Lee kept killing you, so you kept engaging on him and dying instantly, despite back pings from your team, and despite them telling you to please stop.

This was a 22 minute game with 14 deaths.  That doesn't happen unless you are dying the instant you return to lane, which you were doing because you wanted the game to end faster.  You would literally spend more time dead and running to lane than you actually did alive.  You have no games in your history of such high deaths with zero kills or assists - you were doing it on purpose and you know it.  You got caught and punished and are trying to weasel yourself out of punishment.

Next time, if you are tilting that hard, go AFK instead - the punishment for AFK'ing is far less than int'ing, and you can at least claim that your internet was broken or whatever like other people seem to do - you'll get a leaver buster punishment and get longer queue times, but you won't eat a ban unless you do it frequently.  I'd rather a 0/10/1 Yasuo just AFK than continue to run down mid and feed all game to be honest.  

Also, you don't get escalated to a 14-day ban unless you have other stuff already on your record.
